title: England poised to launch major weapon Manu Tuilagi towards New Zealand playmaker Richie Mo'unga
text:
Almost seven years on, the build-up to Chris Ashton’s try against New Zealand at Twickenham looks almost comically simple.

Tom Youngs finds Geoff Parling at the front of an England lineout just beyond the halfway line. Ben Youngs then fizzes a pass to Owen Farrell. Blindside wing Ashton fades behind his fly-half. But the ball does not come his way quite yet.

Instead, Manu Tuilagi carves from out to in. He clatters through Dan Carter, Richie McCaw and Aaron Smith like a pinball tumbling over a trio of dominoes before throwing a dummy to fix full-back Israel Dagg.

Only then, with an entirely unopposed path to the line in front of him, does Ashton get his pass. A typically intelligent support line...
description: Almost seven years on, the build-up to Chris Ashton’s try against New Zealand at Twickenham looks almost comically simple.
